若您是俱備製造業、或工廠背景的人力資源相關工作者，竭誠歡迎您加入!

◆ 漢通科技林口廠/華亞廠，擁有多個製造處、工程處、品保處、支援處、並駐有隸屬總部的iAIoT團隊、採購、行政、物流單位...等

【您會面臨的人力資源任務】

◇ 作為南港總部與林口工廠據點之間，組織發展工作的鏈結
◇ 依企業營運發展方向，促進工廠部門、幕僚部門與總部緊密合作，共同推展適切的人資策略及議題。
◇  透過制度與數據資料分析，檢視組織發展與人力配置有效性，增加工廠營運效能。
◇ 依年度重點策略，規劃與推動各項工廠端人資專案(如：人才盤點專案、技術培訓、用人費用率優化案等…)。
◇ 根據團隊根據企業與事業體的促動的總體方針，促進工廠的部、處單位展開目標、協調與執行
◇ 在符合企業的管理架構下，規劃及建置工廠管理制度，以符合經營管理之需求。

job_name: 板金現場工程師(林口)-PPC
cust_name: 漢通科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
【漢通科技，始於堅實強悍的技術實力】

您是擁有足夠的經驗與跨領域知識
期望有場所可以發揮專業、理想與願景的人嗎？

這裡是神基科技的新一代工作團隊專區！
隸屬於神基科技的產品造型中心，因快速且穩定成長，已從內部服務單位
成長為具備高度獲利能力的利潤中心
而今，需要新思維的您的加入！

新生代與新管理思維，力求組織文化的轉型。
我們需要觀念開放、思考卓越的您，林口華亞廠區，同時由一群年輕或資深、兼具穩健與開放的團隊組成，以堅實的製造相關學經歷背景，期望採取開放而自律的溝通文化，訴求自主思考與充份學習，在追求生產與稽核程序的標準化之虞，也接納超脫於傳統的品質管理思維。
同時也須注意，在工作中思考、與工作中學習中，我們仍不忘精進技術能力，為公司與同仁追求目標的基本方式。

您若具備自律而自主思考，發揮您具備的長才，同時也保有學習初心，協助公司往更專業精深的技能領域前進，並對於組裝、機械、製造、知能工作有相當興趣，喜歡塑造團隊合作的默契與氣氛，我們渴望您的加入！

林口華亞廠，採乾淨明亮的冷氣廠房廠區、先進自動化設備、舒適的內外環境，準備導入標準化、建立完善教育訓練制度與各項程序，期望依照每項專業技能的進階，進行科學化的培育；扁平化的組織架構，期望未來在您的成長與薪酬有最迅速的反應，讓您在追求卓越的同時，更能符合對職涯發展的期盼！

本公司為求各層級人才，竭誠歡迎資深同仁與入門同仁，希望藉由新人的思維、與先進的經驗智慧，共創神基科技 桃園團隊的新氣象！

【本職務主要工作描述】

1.熟悉金屬材質及加工方法 
2.熟悉板金成型相關作業 
3.機台／設備的操作／故障排除檢修
4.機械設備的校驗維護與保養 
5.日常檢查及異常狀況初步研判 
6.具視圖能力

job_name: 生管管理師(桃園)_11600
cust_name: 和碩集團_和碩聯合科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
1.量產接單   
每週提供PC-ATP，與業務等部門確認生產需求。根據需求開工單，修改工單等。 

2.NPI排程
根據PM提的NPI 需求開立工單安排生產。召開新機種導入會等。

3.SMT排程
根據料況齊套日，出貨需求日，治工具數量等要求安排生產排程等。 

4.DIP，Xray，ATE，Router，FVT等多段排程
根據前段排程產出順序, 安排下一個制程段的排程.

5.重工排程
根據會議記錄，開立重工工單，結合重工急迫性安排排程。

6.生產線包裝排程&組裝排程
根據前一制程的排程完工順序，整合未完工訂單。開出對應的包裝工單，安排包裝。

7.出貨排程
根據未出貨訂單，結合與各業管窗口提出的需求出貨日，再整合包裝排程的預估完工進度。同時與進出口確認各訂單的實際派車安排。對每筆訂單設定出貨交期，每日發出出貨排程。

8.協調解決廠內外各單位提出各相關的問題.

job_name: 《桃園市-視訊面試》APPLE專賣店-銷售專員(環球A8)【前六個月保障薪獎3萬3】
cust_name: 德誼數位科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
我們的願景：成為最受客戶信賴的3C精品品牌


工作內容：
1. 門市日常營運，銷售Apple 全系列產品、副廠產品及公司主推產品，以利業績達成。
2. 產品諮詢及專業建議、售後服務與產品保固、裝置保險等…介紹。
3. 確保門市賣場的產品安全性與環境清潔度，符合原廠稽核規範。
4. 商品上架、陳列、盤點、收銀、換貨、改裝、開幕
5. 秉持卓越的服務精神，用心款待每一位顧客。
6. 配合公司商圈規劃進行分發與輪調歷練
7. 主管交辦事項、門市行政工作。

工作優勢：
1. 前六個月保障薪獎3萬3千元起 (完整給予六個足月)。
2. 前三個月新人業績目標減免 (新人可充分學習與培訓)。
3. 位於熱鬧商場、交通便捷、人流量高(業績有保障)。
4. 每年萬元福利，完整照顧每位員工 (長期任職沒煩惱)。

出勤制度：
早班 11:00AM、晚班 13:00PM、每班8小時(不含用餐1小時)。
每月休假依當月週六、週日天數及國定假日天數排休(8-11天不等，例2022十月排休11天)。

福利制度：
1. 員工團體保險
2. 員工結婚津貼
3. 員工生育津貼
4. 員工通話費補助
5. 員工購物折扣
6. 展示機優先認購
7. 年度績效獎金
8. 節日激勵獎金(每年兩次)
9. Apple原廠雙認證專業培訓
10. 在職人員健康檢查
11. 2021年因疫情致百貨停業清消，每人每月多給8天有薪隔離假
12. 2021疫情期間加碼員工防疫險，2022加碼防疫險補助

福委會制度：
1. 三節禮金
2. 每年舉辦團康活動
3. 門市聚會補助(唱歌、聚餐、出遊)
4. 員工旅遊補助(自由行、跟團、票券)
5. 春酒獎項贊助

歡迎具有電信業門市經驗、3C產品銷售門市、店鋪營運管理經驗者，薪資待遇另議。

【前六個月保障本薪+業績獎金3萬3千元起，依當月業績獎金辦法與達成狀況，擇高發放！】

job_name: Manufacturing - Master Plan Planner - Linkou - J-00231349-927
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Do you have experience in Master Planning and love to work closely with stakeholders from many different departments? We are looking for a candidate who is good at solving complex planning problems and able to use limited resource to achieve ASML's business target including the commercial product output and customer service requirement by the most efficient and economical way in time.

Role and responsibilities
•Proactively engaged with Supply Chain Planning team to understand the mid-long term demand trend of platform requirements
•Play as the control tower of demand and supply planning within factory to ensure end-to-end alignment and provide transparent and reliable integral supply and installation plan by optimizing resources and mitigating risk with cost effective driver.

•Optimize the LF Manufacturing (FAB/LAB) capacity planning to meet the mid-to-long-term output demands to satisfy the customer requirement date (CRD) for system level and needed date for module output level
•Engage with demand decision and communicate clear planning strategy from master plan change with all internal stakeholders and cascade to downstream 
•Make steady rhythm planning and make well communication if change.
•Detect output supply risk and bottleneck timely to align with stakeholders for mitigation plan or even solution to ensure production continuity and output in time to fulfill both internal and external customer requirement
•Avoid material and finish goods idle to cause inefficient inventory
•Drive continuous improvement and efficiency with lean concept

Education and experience
Master or higher degree of industry management/engineering
7 years and above working as Production Planner/Supply Chain Planner/IE Engineer in high-tech environment

Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

Soft skill 
•Communication skill
•Skill for prioritizing 
•Skill for organizing
•Strategy thinking 
•Detail management 
•Pressure management 
Hard skill 
•Microsoft office  
•SAP ERP 
•Access or other database
•Visual basic is plus

Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

Other information
The candidate will report to Master Planning and Control manager and needs to work closely with internal and external stakeholders. 
Internal: MPS/YS/RH Manufacturing, Procurement, Supplier Network Management, Product Lifecycle Management, Warehouse, Material Quality, Production Engineering, Business Engineering, Integration Business Planning, Sales Account Support, Customer Supply Chain planning, Customs & Trade
External: Forwarders, 3rd Party Warehouse, Customs or Broker

job_name: Manufacturing - Global re-use Production Engineer - Linkou - J-00259095-245
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
The Global Reuse Center (GRC) is responsible for the re-use of parts, tools & packaging materials in order to accelerate learning, reduce costs and eliminate waste.  The GRC builds the competencies and knowledge on reconditioning processes, executes reconditioning activities according to plan, learns from the reconditioned parts and enables the feedback loop to new designs.
Linkou Global Reuse Center (GRC) is the first ASML reuse center in Taiwan, and will corporate with worldwide Repair center (Netherlands / Korea / US) to realize the concept of “circular economy & sustainability goals" of ASML products.

Role and responsibilities
In this position, you will lead investigations on re-use potential on parts, tools and packaging. You will specify requirements for manufacturing and represent manufacturing in X sector team.  You're the first contact point for issues during execution of re-use activities and support and facilitate the execution team with the right knowledge and skills.
In this position, you will represent your competency on 4 main activities:
1. Parts assessment
2. Execution support
3. Accelerate learning 
4. Support bottom up initiatives
Within these 4 main activities you will have the following tasks:
-Discover and investigate the parts re-use opportunities from various influx channels
-Identify re-use opportunities and translate into an proposal for intake
-Support other departments to realize the reuse activity
-As a contact point for each production line and support their reuse activity with right knowledge and skills
-Cooperate with other ASML colleagues around the world to implement reuse projects or requests
-Design a verification process or test method to verify the performance of reuse parts
-Drives the solution of a technical issue blocking the production progress and improves related documentation/ process descriptions/ manuals 
-Share the experience and knowledge that you learn from reuse process with reuse team to accelerate learning or improve the design
-Verify engineering changes (end of life, upgrade, etc...)  that affect production to ensure product cycle time and quality

Education and experience
• Science / Engineering bachelor/master degree
• In Mechatronics, Electronics, Mechanical, complimented with 2+ years of relevant work experience

Skills
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

•Ability to initiate and drive reuse projects, identify process gaps and work towards improvements
•Is able to think and act within the scope of general policies across sectors
•Demonstrated responsibility for the results in his competence or process
•Be able to use mature skills and technical concepts to find the best solution to a specific problem in an innovative and creative way.
•Ability to prevent technical problems from recurring by learning from previous problems
•Have good communication skills with cross departments to perform reuse activities
•Generate and maintain procedures
•Review engineering change documents and implement it for sustaining team and new product introduction team
•Generate and maintain production routing / sequence / blueprints writing / update
•Have knowledge of lean manufacturing, statistical process control, six sigma

Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

job_name: [TW Pipeline] S&SC - Logistics Supplier Manager - Linkou/Tainan - req55570
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
ASML supports the semiconductor industry’s ongoing quest for producing faster, smarter and more energy efficient chips. We are a young, dynamic, international and highly skilled workforce. ASML creates the systems that the lithography industry needs to achieve its goals. This can only be accomplished with a strong support of our suppliers.

Are you challenged by managing our strategic suppliers and supply chain towards competitive performance? Would you like to deliver input for ASMLs 2020 strategy? Is change management part of you DNA? And do you enjoy managing stakeholders at senior and executive level at our suppliers? Then this might be the job for you.

Role and responsibilities
As member of the supplier account teams the Logistics Supplier Manager drives suppliers towards competitive supply chain performance. Main focus is on the capacity alignment, reliability and flexibility of global supply while mitigating the risks within the supply chain.
As a Logistics Supplier Manager you are the main interface towards our suppliers regarding supply chain topics with 3 focus areas: Supplier Development, Supply Chain Risk Mitigation and Project Management. 
Supplier Development
* Manage suppliers towards competitive and sustainable supply chain performance by executing audits and managing improvement plans
* Drive lead time reduction programs at suppliers
* Optimize output of the supplier and n-tier to meet ASML demand and demand changes
Supply Chain Risk Mitigation
* Capacity alignment across n-tier supply chain
* Proactively execute supply chain risk analysis and execute action plans to mitigate risk
* Manage escalations to solve bottlenecks in supply chain and avoid re-occurrence
Project Management
* Lead supply chain re-allocation projects
* Initiate and lead high impact (cross sectoral) improvement projects
* Manage and align with internal and external stakeholders

Education and experience
MSc degree in, supply chain, (industrial) engineering, or Business Administration.
* 5~8+ years relevant work experience
* Experience in high tech, low volume industry is a pre
* Experience in supplier management
* Experience with supply chain processes in production environment (e.g. supply chain improvements, supplier management, customer service, planning)
* Experience in project management (Lean 6S experience, Black Belt certification preferred)

Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

* Excellent stakeholder management and relationship building skills
* Conceptual thinker on strategic level
* Strong analytical skills
* Convincing / negotiation skills
* Pragmatic and result driven 
* Pro-active attitude, drive for improvement

Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

job_name: Manufacturing - Factory Expansion Project Leader - Linkou - J-00257868-925
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Program team of ASML Linkou Factory to lead, enable and deliver ASML Linkou Factory future growth and breakthrough
Project Lead for ASML Linkou factory expansion project and business breakthrough in order to meet the objectives of 3-5 years Linkou factory growth

Role and responsibilities
►Implement, and maintain program initiatives that adhere to organizational objectives
►Maintain organizational standards of satisfaction, quality, and performance
►Work with program manager for assigned projects to plan and develop scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, budget, and timing for new initiatives
►Execute analysis and evaluation for optimal return-on-investment and define project initiatives
►Identify key requirements needed from cross-functional teams and external vendors
►Develop options and solutions by coordinating stakeholders in time and control project progress
►Escalate risks in a timely manner and setup review meetings with management and stakeholders for project progress
The macro economic view of ASML going into 2025 will see a significant growth in business and in revenue. In order to materialize this growth potential, The Project Lead will take on the lead role in industrial footprint, factory capabilities, efficiency drive, quality improvement and any other new project based initiatives to support ASML Linkou (Taiwan) to reinforce the competitive position and be a pathfinder to look ahead for ASML Linkou (Taiwan) future growth and road to operation excellence.

Education and experience
►Master's degree in engineering major
►3+ years in factory working environment and 1+ years in facility engineering related job role

Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred
Proven ability to solve problems under the pressure of time
Strong familiarity with project management software tools, methodologies, and best practices
Excellent analytical skills
Strong interpersonal skills and extremely resourceful
Proven ability to complete projects according to outlined scope, budget, and timeline
Commercial awareness
Ability to motivate people
Communication skills
Teamworking skills
Management and leadership skills

Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

Other information
Good in English

job_name: D&E - Software Designer (C#) - Linkou - J-00260021-195
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Would you like to create novel software that helps make Moore's Law possible? At ASML we create full-stack software products that run in the most modern Semiconductor Fabs in the world, and we are always pushing the boundary of what is possible. Now, we are looking for C# software engineer to join us. This could be your next job, so if you would like to join us - please apply!
Within ASML, the sector Development and Engineering is responsible for the specification, design, integration, qualification, and sustaining of all ASML products. Taking advantage of customer and manufacturing proximity, the D&E Applications Software of the ASML Center of Excellence (ACE) is located in Linkou, Taiwan

Role and responsibilities
As a C# software engineer you will join one of our multinational Scrum teams to create state of the art software solutions. We are committed to follow the Agile way of working, with sprints and demos every three weeks, aiming for frequent releases of working software. In all teams we cooperate with internal and external experts from different knowledge domains to discover and build the best solutions possible. We use tools like Continuous Integration with GIT,Jira and Bamboo. We move fast to help our customers reach their goals, and we strive to create reliable and well-tested software, as a failure in our software stack can severely impact customers' operations.
-Develop software applications for the semiconductor metrology equipment (YieldStar) and other holistic lithography solutions for ASML products.
-Translate business requirements into software solutions and continuously improve the software to meet customer’s needs.
-Design, implement, test, deliver and document software system mainly written in C#.
-Drive and align on technical direction with all to assure impact of software changes is properly documented, reviewed and accepted by all stakeholders. 
-Review and assure quality on software deliverables (design, code, test, document, etc.) throughout the software lifecycle.
-Take ownership for product realization by providing high quality designs, product documentation and software implementation

Education and experience
A relevant Bachelor or Master in software engineering, computerscience, information systems, IT or other related subject with emphasis on software development.
Solid experienced software engineer or leader using objectoriented paradigm. At least 1~2 years or preferred 3-5 years of C# development.Hands-on experience on the .NET platform (C#, LINQ, Threading, Remoting, WPF, XML, IO, etc.).Experience on software product development lifecycles, using UML, OOP, design patterns and best practices.

Skills
• You have good communications (downward, upward, and sideways), people interaction and teamwork skills.
• You are open-minded, you like to discuss about technical challenges and you want to push the boundaries of technology.
• You are client and quality oriented – you do not settle for second best solutions, but you strive to find the best ways to acquire top results.
• You are an innovator and you constantly seek to improve your knowledge and your work

Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

Other information
 

Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.

job_name: Manufacturing - YieldStar Production Engineer - Linkou - J-00266251-569
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Role and responsibilities
As F&T competency expert for solve related structural issue in factory(Electrical Layout, Contamination & Thermal Control).
The general purpose of the F&T and PWP is to ensure that our systems can provide stable thermal control, un-interrupt power, uniform light and PWP to ensure good wafer measure during production without contamination.
As a F&T and PWP engineer you will be responsible to troubleshoot & resolve issues related to equipment problems in the sub-competences; Flow and temperature control, defectivity. This requires a strong analytical skill-set combined with clear and understandable communication. Next to that it is required to have affinity with hands-on skills.
General mission and responsibility
- Continuous Improvement
- Increase efficiency
- Increase quality
- Decrease cycle times
- Decrease costs
General scope of the role:
•NPI product transfer form design to HVM
•Participates and drives projects and process improvements
•Focus on preventing issues and achieving the right quality.
•Optimize the production process and perform Issue tracking/solving to be able to transfer the product into the volume organization
•Masters a single competence well enough to work independently
•Project planning and risk assessment
Functional competencies and working contents
•Technical competence(Metrology, Mechatronics)
-Optimize solutions for specific problems in an innovative and creative way base on technical knowledge
-Analyze and select the best solution for specific problems from all known possible solutions, in an innovative and creative way
-Identifies gaps and drives solution, ensures processes are adapted to prevent (work) process errors from recurring
•Project management and risk assessment
-Operate as integrator Joining NPI(New Product Introduction) well prepared introduction in the pilot-factory
•Progress improvement:
-Initiate and drive new procedures changes
-Prevent technical disturbances from repeating by implementing learning from previous platform issues and enforcing R4V (Release for Volume) according PGP
•Team work:
-Communicate and able to co-work with across department levels
-Proactively seek out ways to reach beyond team and support others in accomplishing goals

Education and experience
• Bachelor’s Degree in technical science (Material Science, Physics, Mechatronics, Electronics, Process technology, Aerospace Engineering) or equivalent experience. 
•Preferably 3 years of experience in a production environment with high tech products and complex production processes, preferably in both assembly and test environment;
•Experience in the field of Technical Production Engineering and quality methodology such as statistical process control and FMEA is an advantage.
•Experience with Optics and/or Metrology and/or Mechatronics knowledge is preferred.
• Experience of working under pressure and deadline.
• Experience solving complex technical problems by analyzing data and creating deterministic forward looking action plans.
• Strong communicator in English (both oral and written).

Skills
•Takes ownership
•Can learn and apply new information or skills.
•Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents.
•Hands on mentality
•Focused on safety and quality
• Ability to complete assignments with attention to detail and high degree of accuracy.
• Proven ability to perform effectively in a demanding environment with changing workloads and deadlines.
•Result driven-demonstrate ownership and accountability.
•Broad technical and business knowledge;
•Effective interpersonal skills; able to convince others;
•Demonstrate open, clear, concise and professional communication.
•Team player;
•LabVIEW, C++, excel (plus);
•Proficient in English

job_name: Manufacturing - NPI Production Engineer - Linkou - J-00263174-450
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
The sector Linkou Factory is responsible for the production of Metrology tools, Reticle handlers and Wafer scanners. The complete production process of the most advanced machines takes place within Manufacturing.
The Production Engineering within this sector introduces new products and corresponding processes from Development into Volume production (including the system installation and qualification process at the customer location), continuously adapts and optimizes the production and installation processes and provides support in connection with the organization.
Besides the NPI Production Engineering group, there is also a group called Sustaining Engineering working with headquarter Development to contribute from NPI to HVM to achieve fast ramp up, drive product cost and deliver quality improvement. These two groups report to the NPI Engineering under LAB organization.

Role and responsibilities
To design, maintain, and optimize production processes and adapt to changed output requirements. Develop and apply methods of measuring the performance of the production process. Support the Production in order to ensure product quality, solve the blocking issue and drive product maturity up to Volume production.
Providing inputs/feedbacks to NPI PL for Manufacturing requirements to achieving fast/smooth delivery and product cost reduction.
Production Engineer from mechanical build and qualification in the ASSY work centre till System integration and qualification in TEST and Install.
New Product Introduction:
• Lays down operating instructions, process flow charts, routings, process parameters and indicators. 
• Brings his/her knowledge to bear on new product development projects, in order to foresee production problems in the design phase and in order to improve the manufacturability of the product and test design.
Continuous Improvement:
• Analyses the production process, points out structural problems and bottlenecks, works out suggestions for improvements and initiates their implementation, often in close cooperation with the surrounded departments as Development, Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain and Customer Support.
Support: 
• Contributes to the rapid solution of complex faults and takes the necessary initiatives and practical decisions.
• For escalations, travel to install locations might be required.

Education and experience
Bachelor degree or above in Engineering or equivalent

• Over 3-5 years of experience;
• Experience in a production environment with high tech products and complex production processes, preferably in both assembly and test environment.
• Experience in the field of Technical Production Engineering and quality methodology such as statistical process control and FMEA is an advantage.

Skills
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

• Broad technical and business knowledge. 
• Strong analytical mind. 
• Focused on quality and continuous improvement.
• Adequate English language skills in speech and writing.
• Team player.
• Good social and communication skills.
• Effective interpersonal skills; able to convince others
• Flexible, can cope with stress.
• Very active, plenty of initiative.

Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

job_name: D&E - Distributed Computing Infrastructure Developer - Linkou - J-00257048-641
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Role and responsibilities
Maintain and extend the current DC/OS platform that the chip factories can depend on. Participate in the development of the next generation of the platform which is based on K8S.You don’t write obscure scripts that people will forget exist. Instead, you’ll contribute to the platform that is essential to the chip manufacturers, and in turn essential for the coming generations many semiconductor based devices. The platform itself consists of a scale-able and distributed data and compute 
infrastructure. The scale and complexity of the platform gives everyone involved the opportunity to keep learning new things. You are a senior engineer able to pull your own weight and train and support others.
Be part of this compute platform that is one of the main pillars under the production of the next generation microchips of Apple, Samsung and many others.
You will be working in the virtual compute platform (VCP). This platform is developed inside ASML to host compute and analytics applications that aim to improve the yield in the semiconductor factories of our customers.

These applications take data from ASML equipment. They combine this data to real time production corrections. The corrections are sent back to the ASML production equipment. Failure of the platform has high impact. It would mean failure of the customers (tsmc, Samsung, Intel etc.) production facility.

The on-premise platform is currently developed based on DC/OS. We are in the process of migrating to Kubernetes. We develop the platform aspects in our team. Scheduling of resources, containerization, fail-over and data collection from scanner and measurement devices inside the fab. We have an up time expectation of 4 nine’s.

Installations and upgrades are automated with Ansible. Other technologies you may encounter are Spark for data processing, Kafka for notifications and high volume data ingestion. Hadoop and HBASE are used for data storage. Hyper converged CEPH storage is one of the candidates to replace the HDP stack.

Your responsibilities:
Implement the product features with the team
Automate tests to the implemented features
Help application developers to understand the infrastructure/cluster/system
Increase platform reliability by improving system resilience (bug-fixing and beyond)

Education and experience
 A relevant BSc or MSc in the area of software engineering, computer science, information systems, IT or MIS
**Senior** software engineer, you are a *developer* delivering platform *infrastructure-as-code* for more than 6 years
Hands on skills in Ansible (incl. playbook creation, multi-node management) or Hadoop (incl. trouble shooting) – must have
Linux administration and scripting (ours is RHEL-based) – must have
Development skills in Python or Bash – must have
*Platform-thinking* mindset: our deliveries have a large community of different stakeholders, and you will contribute on making it smooth, resilient, clean
Past proven experience with Kubernetes *development* – is a plus

Hard Skills:
Containerization, Kubernetes, Ansible, Docker, Spark, Python/Bash, Kafka,
Linux, OS Hardening, Azure UI, RHEL
Hadoop and HBASE, CEPH, MongoDb, Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP)
Networking, understand TCP/IP protocol, troubleshoot firewall config issues etc.
Having this experience is a large plus:
DC/OS

Skills
You take ownership and you support your team, you are the backbone of your group.
You are client and quality oriented – you do not settle for second best solutions, but you strive to find the best ways to acquire top results.
You like to solve problems (permanently)
You are open to Challenges
You think outside the box
You can look through the customer eyes, what worked before may need to change for a customer X
You automate
You have a positive attitude and are not stuck in dogmas, you combine a fresh view and apply experience equally

For more information, please visit:
https://asml.csod.com/ux/ats/careersite/1/home/requisition/53307?c=asml

job_name: S&SC - Procurement Account Manager (Computer System) - Linkou - J-00253796-357
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job

In this position you will manage assigned suppliers and an overall commodity/category (supply base) to ensure ASML is supported by world-class suppliers delivering on time, at spec, good quality and at the lowest total cost.


Role and responsibilities

Strategically develops vision and targets of supplier landscape by pursuing critical technology roadmap and product roadmap in collaboration with category manager while considering regional needs.
Jointly defines and executes category strategy with Category PFT (Product Family Team) and strategic supplier account plans at suppliers.
Proactively monitors developments and trends within the supply base for Silicon Base Devices and ensures ASML is prepared to react appropriately for short, mid and long terms.
Drives supplier selection activities by leading one or more Sourcing Teams.
Prepares and presents for key decision making in executive review meetings, regarding make/buy decisions and supplier selections.
Negotiates Long Term Supply Agreements (LTSA), NPI Agreements, and associated addendums, and monitors contractual compliance of the supplier as well as ASML.
Drives continuous cost and lead time reduction.
Take lead to manage suppliers’ QLTCS performance with SAT (“Supplier Account Team”) through review processes on regular basis (eg ORM and ERM).
Prepares supplier spending forecasts and monitors supplier financial health.
Ensures all communication to the supplier is coordinated and consistent.
Drives supply base rationalization within the categories.
Participates in supplier overall capabilities audits and drives closure of findings and improvement plans. 


Education and experience

Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain, Logistics Management, Engineering or related field is required or equivalent experience a minimum of 10 years of progressive experience in supplier management in a high-tech, international manufacturing environment.
A deep understanding of one or more technology-related supply chains is strongly preferred. Due to the strategic nature of the commodities/categories involved, a proven track record in developing strong business relationships with key suppliers and experience in developing and executing long term agreements is required.
Experience with complex negotiations, problem solving, strategic planning and financial analysis are essential.
Ability to travel domestically and internationally required.
Knowledge of continuous improvement techniques is a big plus and a strong familiarity with technology manufacturing is highly preferred.

Skills

Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:
Proficient with Microsoft Office (i.e. Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).
Excellent written and verbal communications in English are essential. Negotiation skills are critical.
Operate effectively with all levels of management both internally and externally.
Ability to lead cross-functional teams is essential to performing the job.
Must be able to professionally represent ASML to outside companies/suppliers.
Ability to build a strong (internal and external) networks.
Ability to get buy-in and commitment from both internal and external stakeholders.
Willingness to “constructively dissent” and challenge management thinking on key issues.
Must thrive in an environment where multi-tasking is the norm.
Strong vision of supplier landscape, supply chain networks and technology roadmap.

job_name: CRE - Contamination Control Engineer - Linkou - J-00234324-655
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
A job as a Contamination Control Engineer at ASML Linkou Factory could be your perfect path to new knowledge in multiple engineering disciplines.

Support and advise the Manufacturing & Logistics department on contamination control,  i.e. machine and clean room related processes and issues, in order to optimize production flow and ensure product quality, short lead-times and ‘short time to market’ by continuous improvement of ASML’s new and existing products and processes.

Role and responsibilities
Lays down operating instructions, process flow charts and processes to reduce the contamination risks in our processes.
Supports the CRE with their processes, provides knowledge and helps maintaining the processes for clean room control, like training, standardization of used materials and way of workings, alterations (e.g. renovations of existing clean rooms), measurement group and clean room supervision.[RvL1] 
Contributes to the rapid solution of complex faults and issues and takes the necessary initiatives and practical decisions with respect to the overall way of working and organization in the clean room
Introduce and/or co-develop tooling to reduce the contamination risks in our processes and clean room and maintain the needed quality and amount of tools
Creating awareness and providing training programs for colleagues and external field engineers on contamination control
Work with the supply chain to get a clean product to ASML Linkou Factory
Helps in analyzing the production process within our factory, points out structural problems and bottlenecks with respect to contamination, works out suggestions for improvements and initiates their implementation, if needed in close cooperation with the surrounded departments as Development, Operations, and Customer Support.
Pro-actively cooperate with our global network of subject experts to solve ASML product-specific contamination problems.

Education and experience
Relevant bachelor or master degree e.g. Physics or Engineering

5+ years of relevant work experience within Clean room Control, Contamination Control, General Engineering
Experience in a production environment with low Volume, high tech products and complex production processes
Preferably knowledge of assembly, adjusting and qualification process in a clean room environment in general
Knowledge about particle / contamination control measurements.
Knowledge of Lean Manufacturing, Flow

Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

Broad technical and business knowledge
Good communication skills
Get-on and do it mentality
Initiative
Focused on quality and continuous improvement
Team player
Flexibility
Quality commitment

It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. job_name: [Taiwan Pipeline] D&E - Software Design Engineer (C#) - Linkou - req30860
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
ASML 將於10~11月舉辦各校秋季招募，歡迎應屆畢業生投遞應徵。
11/5 前投遞履歷，合適者約2周內會有專人與你聯絡，面試將安排在11/15-11/19

說明會場次： 【10/6 清華大學】 【10/7 中山大學】 【10/12 中央大學】【10/13 陽明交通大學】 【10/20 中正大學】 【10/21 台灣科技大學】【10/23 成功大學】【11/3 台北科技大學】 【11/4 中興大學】 【11/10 逢甲大學】【11/25 高雄科技大學】

Introduction
Would you like to create novel software that helps make Moore's Law possible? At ASML we create full-stack software products that run in the most modern Semiconductor Fabs in the world, and we are always pushing the boundary of what is possible. Now, we are looking for C# software engineer to join us. This could be your next job, so if you would like to join us - please apply!

Sector and department information
Within ASML, the sector Development and Engineering is responsible for the specification, design, integration, qualification, and sustaining of all ASML products. Taking advantage of customer and manufacturing proximity, the D&E Applications Software of the ASML Center of Excellence (ACE) is located in Linkou, Taiwan

Job Mission
As a C# software engineer you will join one of our multinational Scrum teams to create state of the art software solutions. We are committed to follow the Agile way of working, with sprints and demos every three weeks, aiming for frequent releases of working software. In all teams we cooperate with internal and external experts from different knowledge domains to discover and build the best solutions possible. We use tools like Continuous Integration with GIT,Jira and Bamboo. We move fast to help our customers reach their goals, and we strive to create reliable and well-tested software, as a failure in our software stack can severely impact customers' operations.

Job Description
-Develop software applications for the semiconductor metrology equipment (YieldStar) and other holistic lithography solutions for ASML products.
-Translate business requirements into software solutions and continuously improve the software to meet customer’s needs.

job_name: CS - DUV Global Support Engineer (Top/Bottom) - Linkou - J-00256596-228
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Are you aware of the fact that every electronic device costing €100 and up, contains a chip which is made with an ASML lithographic tool? Did you know that the next generation of tablets and smartphones is only made possible due to the fast evolving technological capabilities of ASML? 
More important, do you want to join us in shaping the future?

ASML is a high-tech fast growing Dutch company head-quartered near Eindhoven with local offices at our customers worldwide (e.g. Intel, IBM, Samsung) As market leader in the semiconductor industry ASML designs and manufactures complex lithographic systems. The customer service division consists of local offices at every customer site and a team of experts to support these local teams when complex technical problems are encountered.

Role and responsibilities
Job Mission
ASML produces high tech and high value tools. Downtime of these tools is very expensive for our customers. ASML Customer Support organization is responsible for the repair of the systems as soon as possible. As expert it is your mission to be the linking pin between problems seen at high tech customers and the solution.

Job Description
A role as Global Support Center (GSC) Engineer at ASML consists of a diversity of tasks and responsibilities:

1.Solving complex technical problems together with the local team most of the time remote, often on-site. (up to 30% of your time)
2.A continuous drive to stay updated and informed on new technologies, functionalities and products. Being eager to learn and absorb this knowledge are very valuable.
3.Sharing knowledge and expertise amongst colleagues within the GSC and with local engineers to increase the efficiency of our customer service. Travelling on-site when new system types are introduced to customers is an example of this aspect. 
The diversity of technical problems encountered in the “Bottom module – wafer stage and wafer handler” team requires a broad knowledge level. This makes that a GSC bottom engineer grows very valuable general system knowledge. For this reason a job within this team is an excellent starting function for a career in a high tech environment. Growth possibilities in both technical and managerial directions can be thought of. 

Bottom module – wafer stage and wafer handler
Top as the science of servo control and mechanism is very diverse. Within the context of ASML, the general purpose of bottom module to ensure fast and accurate wafer transfer, optimize servo control to be able to position wafer as required set points and have overall system knowledge of relevant subsystems to ensure nanometer accuracy during exposures.

Education and experience
Education
Master degree in technical science (Physics, Mechatronics, Electronics, Chemistry, Aerospace Engineering, Process technology, etc.) or equivalent experience is desired.

Experience
• Knowledge of ASML equipment on a specialized technical level is a pre

Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

•“Get things done” mentality
•Pro-active attitude 
•Strong analytical skills
•Interpersonal abilities (Can relate well to others, both colleagues and customers)
•Effective communicator in English (both oral and written)
•Customer-oriented
•Flexible in working hours, travel and work environments
•Team player
•Stress resistant

job_name: S&SC - Supplier Quality Engineer - Linkou - J-00255844-275
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
ASML supports the semiconductor industry’s ongoing quest for producing faster, smarter and more energy efficient chips. We are a young, dynamic, international and highly skilled workforce. ASML creates the systems that the lithography industry needs to achieve its goals. This can only be accomplished with a strong support of our suppliers.


Role and responsibilities
As a Supply Quality Engineer, you will take a pivotal role as a linking pin between the ASML D&E development team and the related development team of the supplier, with a primary focus on parts quality. You maintains and develops at an operational level the relation to the supplier with the purpose to create an optimal engineering collaboration between supplier and ASML while managing all the critical quality elements of full lifecycle of product from NPI stage to Volume. Using your personal skills, you will work closely together with the supplier & ASML internal stakeholders to optimize the effectiveness and efficiency of the product generation process, in alignment with the ASML project plan. The main goal of this cross-sector activity is to secure an excellent quality of parts delivered by our suppliers.


The main responsibilities are:
•Early supplier involvement in the D&E project to secure that technology expertise of ASML and supplier are merged in the best way.
•Ensure that not only parts quality, however, also manufacturability and serviceability aspects are covered in the design phase.
•Document the D&E project collaboration, including supplier & ASML responsibilities and roles via a Statement of Work (SoW).
•New product introduction (NPI) and supplier selection.
•Deliverables that secure parts quality from suppliers in the ASML product generation process
•Responsible for the entire Quality and Technical process performance for suppliers, including operational interface on deviations from specifications
•Monitor, review and drive supplier quality performance from incidents to structural improvement
•Contribute to supplier development (e.g. implementing SPC, lean, FMEA, operational excellence at suppliers)
•Optimize manufacturing processes at suppliers by improving quality, testing and qualification infrastructure 
•Drive yield and process improvements at suppliers. Actively participate in improvement projects at suppliers (cycle time reduction, cost of goods reduction)
•Carry-out analyses of quality and logistical issues to drive technical solutions needed during material availability escalations
•Support implementation of hardware changes at suppliers


The core competencies are:
•Production process qualification for R4V of mains products (PFMEA)
•Manufacturing conform standards (UL508A).
•Process to maintain and improve products-SPC
•Ability to added value testing strategy (zero NFF)
•Supply chain management / highest reliability
•Technology leadership for the specific (mains)product
•Technology competence/Technical Dev.Comp.(incl. EOL)

Education and experience
BSc or MSc in Mechatronics Engineering. 
Broad (at least 5-8 years) experience in high tech environment with a focus on supplier management or part quality or project management in Electro-mechanics engineering. Candidate must be trained and experienced with Quality systems and methods (preferably Six Sigma Green or Black belt), as well as Engineering towards production processes. Specialism in electro-mechanic assemblies.

Skills
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

The following personal skills are crucial to a successful execution:
• Ability to initiate, influence and steer without formal authority.
• Strong networker with good negotiating and team building skills
• Strong communicator.
• Ability to switch between complex matters and high-level conclusions.

cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
A challenging project management opportunity for academic professionals with experience in new product introductions, lifecycle management, supply chain or production in high tech-low volume environments.

Role and responsibilities
Interfacing ASML’s Business Lines, we manage the installed base products and services including (engineering) changes and the phase out of products – taking supply chain requirements into account. It is our mission to enable concurrent engineering, manage complex product changes, secure the availability of materials and optimize demand and supply and pursue volume planning excellence.

As Project Lead, you’ll make a real difference to the efficiency and profitability of the company by determining and managing the supply chain project plan of platforms, industrialization and phase-out strategies. Managing risks and requirements at product level. Manage requirements at function development level. To achieve this, you will be using your unique mix of technical, creative and interpersonal skills and you’ll guide and coordinate your team of supply chain team members. 

Manage supply chain Life Cycle Management (LCM) & Software Infrastructure and Computer Systems (SICS) for DUV products in NPI and release-for-volume
Drive IRM from PLM/SCM perspective, during the product lifecycle for DUV LCM & SICS products
Manage supply chain requirements & deliverables through key decision gates of ASML’s Product Generation Process
Manage material availability balanced against customer service levels, inventory, quality, costs and risks: Identify bottle necks, prepare decisions and take actions towards engineering, suppliers, factories and field

Education and experience
MSc degree in (industrial) engineering or supply chain.

5 – 10 yrs work experience, of which 2 – 5 yrs experience in new product introductions preferably in high-tech, low-volume environments. 

Skills

To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

Result orientation, act under high pressure
Stakeholder management : deal effectively with internal and external stakeholders both at operational and executive levels
Organize cross functional cooperation
Able to coach team members
Excellent professional communication in English. Dutch preferred

Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

Other information
Supply Chain Management (SCM) is an industry-leading operations organization, responsible for ensuring material availability to ASML’s factories and customers. Our DNA contains customer focus, concurrent engineering, virtual integration plus the ability to thrive in a volatile market, accelerate the supply chain and deliver creative solutions. SCM plans up to four years ahead while customer requirements and system bill of materials can change at any time. Any break in material availability can have an unacceptable impact for our customers. So SCM must proactively identify and solve potential issues by working closely with our technical departments and customers, and actively managing an extensive supplier base. With over 350 highly educated and motivated people, SCM has contributed to ASML being named “Best Factory” in the Netherlands and in the top 4 in Europe.

job_name: CS - DUV Technical Training Instructor/Developer - Linkou - J-00259928-590
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Within our department you work in one or more projects supporting the learning needs of our (internal) customers. Being in touch with several departments (e.g. Manufacturing, Global Support Centre, Competence Engineering and D&E) you translate (internal) customer requirements into training packages. You will train engineers on several levels: Level 1: Introduction to the machine (functional overview and machine operation). Level 2: Fab Ready (installations, major replacements, calibrations and recovery). Level 3: Advanced subjects (troubleshooting & diagnosing).

Role and responsibilities
Your mission will be to work as part of team providing learning solutions in a challenging and dynamic technical environment. Flexibility and innovation are required to match the expectations of our (internal) customers.

As a Technical Instructor/Developer you will be responsible for developing and delivering blended high quality technical training (Instructor Led Training (ILT), Web Based Training (WBT), Case Based Learning (CBL), Virtual Classroom (VR), animations, training reference material, etc.) to engineers (mainly) from the CS Sector.
Developing and delivering training is based on an Instructional Model called Analyze Design Develop Implement Evaluate (ADDIE). You will be part of a Project Team working on all phases of ADDIE. You will also be responsible for creating training solutions to issues reported from Customer Support (CS) engineers in the Field. Additionally as a Developer you will work with employees, from the CS Field Factory organization and Development & Engineering (D&E), to develop the training content for new products being released to the CS Field Factory Organization.
You will be a member of the CS Global Training Center (CS GTC, ~100 employees worldwide).

Education and experience
• Higher Technical College or (Technical) University (B.Sc./M.Sc.) in Electrical Technology, Mechatronics, Chemistry, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or Computer Science.

•2-3 years of delivering Technical Training.
•Proven affinity with or expertise in education and/or didactics.
•Experience working in operation and/or field and have understanding of wow.

Skills
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

•Team-player, communicate pro-actively, have a healthy business sense and are on top of new opportunities which add value to our core business.
•A passion for training, teaching and learning.
•Good written and spoken English with Didactical skills and Cultural awareness.
•Analytic, abstract thinking, initiative, independent, sharing knowledge, stress tolerance and flexibility.

Other information
Within our department you work in one or more projects supporting the learning needs of our (internal) customers. Being in touch with several departments (e.g. Manufacturing, Global Support Centre, Competence Engineering and D&E) you analyze translate requests into clear reachable objectives, into modular learning solutions. You will train engineers on several levels: Level 1: Introduction to the machine (functional overview and machine operation). Level 2: Fab Ready (installations, major replacements, calibrations and recovery). Level 3: Advanced subjects (troubleshooting & diagnosing).

This position is within the CS sector, home based location; Linkou in Taiwan (Asian Center of Excellence (ACE)). The CS Organization is responsible for the installation, relocation, qualification, upgrades, repair and maintenance of the ASML systems at our customers’ sites. Responsible for the necessary transfer of know-how to the customer. Local Customer Support field engineers perform these tasks at the customers within their specific region.

job_name: CRE - Project Manager - Linkou - J-00251719-970
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Project manager (construction/facility system) executing ASML business strategy.
Project Manager will be responsible to manage several constructions/renovation projects. The project manager is leading these projects and therefore responsible for managing the resources, quality, timing and scope. Characteristics for the projects in scope are: multidisciplinary, technical complex, covering longer time-lapse or fast track, project budgets up to, but not limited, to 10M Euro, complex stakeholder management.
Role and responsibilities
Key Areas of Responsibility:
• Drive technical, complex and multidisciplinary Projects according to the CRE Building Generation Process (BGP)
• Work closely with the Business Partner, F&M, REDS and other departments to deliver the -challenged- customer needs (identify & define the best fit for ASML in your Program of Requirements, and arrange needed internal & external resources)
• Always secure Business Continuity of the CRE Region TW/SG production facilities
• Create and maintain safe, healthy and environmentally secured working conditions
• Put in your effort to further develop our BGP process by evaluating and learning on the job during your projects
• Manages, monitors and reports on the project budget progress and projections/forecasts and consolidates all project related financial issues. Ensure financial accountability according to ASML policies
• Manages, monitors and reports on the projects scope and quality specifications and consolidates all project related quality issues.
• Manages, monitors and reports on the progress and consolidates all project related progress issues
• Selection, deployment, facilitation and management of project manager(s), project management support (consultants) and contractors.
Key Decisions
•Responsible for decision making on solutions with impact on operations; in corporation with service managers (hard, soft), competence engineers, asset managers, risk & compliancy and supplier & contract managers.
• Responsible for making a fair judgement and / or decision making on effectiveness of projects and make adjustments were needed.

Education and experience
Relevant bachelor or master degree e.g. (Technical) Business Administration, Facilities Management, Engineering.
7~10+ years of relevant project experience; construction/renovation projects in international high tech production

Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

Fluent verbally and in writing in Mandarin Chinese and proficient in English Language
Knowledge of LEAN, PMBoK , relevant quality standards, legislation , MS Projects and Office.
ability to handle multiple requests and work on management and operational level.
Good relational skills, capable of handling cultural and political barriers.

Other information
The Project Manager is in charge of several Regional CRE construction/renovation projects. ASML business will be the user of the sites, Region CRE Delivery and Supply Management will be responsible for all maintenance. The Project Manager reports to the Delivery & Supply Hard Service Manager.
Stakeholders: Site manager, Program managers, Consultants and Contractors, Regional Competence & Quality, Procurement (contracting), Finance, Environment Health Safety & Security
Execute LKF new plant projects, such as: LK campus , common plate form, SP3, HBS, ICRT expansion, etc. These projects are more than 1M euros and exceeding the workload of the one project leader.
Knowledge of LEAN, PMBoK/Prince is an advantage.

Calibrates, qualifies and installs ASML's products according to the highest quality standards and world class delivery performance

job_name: CS - Global Support Center Engineer (Top/Bottom) - Linkou - J-00259929-957
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Are you aware of the fact that every electronic device costing €100 and up, contains a chip which is made with an ASML lithographic tool? Did you know that the next generation of tablets and smartphones is only made possible due to the fast evolving technological capabilities of ASML? 
More important, do you want to join us in shaping the future?

ASML is a high-tech fast growing Dutch company head-quartered near Eindhoven with local offices at our customers worldwide (e.g. Intel, IBM, Samsung) As market leader in the semiconductor industry ASML designs and manufactures complex lithographic systems. The customer service division consists of local offices at every customer site and a team of experts to support these local teams when complex technical problems are encountered.

Role and responsibilities
Job Mission
ASML produces high tech and high value tools. Downtime of these tools is very expensive for our customers. ASML Customer Support organization is responsible for the repair of the systems as soon as possible. As expert it is your mission to be the linking pin between problems seen at high tech customers and the solution.

Job Description
A role as Global Support Center (GSC) Engineer at ASML consists of a diversity of tasks and responsibilities:

1.Solving complex technical problems together with the local team most of the time remote, often on-site. (up to 30% of your time)
2.A continuous drive to stay updated and informed on new technologies, functionalities and products. Being eager to learn and absorb this knowledge are very valuable.
3.Sharing knowledge and expertise amongst colleagues within the GSC and with local engineers to increase the efficiency of our customer service. Travelling on-site when new system types are introduced to customers is an example of this aspect. 
The diversity of technical problems encountered in the “Bottom module – wafer stage and wafer handler” team requires a broad knowledge level. This makes that a GSC bottom engineer grows very valuable general system knowledge. For this reason a job within this team is an excellent starting function for a career in a high tech environment. Growth possibilities in both technical and managerial directions can be thought of. 

Bottom module – wafer stage and wafer handler
Top as the science of servo control and mechanism is very diverse. Within the context of ASML, the general purpose of bottom module to ensure fast and accurate wafer transfer, optimize servo control to be able to position wafer as required set points and have overall system knowledge of relevant subsystems to ensure nanometer accuracy during exposures.

Education and experience
Education
Master degree in technical science (Physics, Mechatronics, Electronics, Chemistry, Aerospace Engineering, Process technology, etc.) or equivalent experience is desired.

Experience
• Knowledge of ASML equipment on a specialized technical level is a pre

Skills
•“Get things done” mentality
•Pro-active attitude 
•Strong analytical skills
•Interpersonal abilities (Can relate well to others, both colleagues and customers)
•Effective communicator in English (both oral and written)
•Customer-oriented
•Flexible in working hours, travel and work environments
•Team player
•Stress resistant


Other information
Need to know more about applying for a job at ASML? Read our frequently asked questions.

job_name: CS - DUV Global Support Engineer (ILP) - Linkou - J-00261209-666
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Are you a team player who wants to be the linking pin between problems seen at high tech customers and the solution in a multicultural environment? Then join us in our international team of technical experts. The goal is to remotely solve technical challenges, however due to complexity of our products an ASML Global Support Center (GSC) engineer often gets the opportunity to travel for problem solving at customer site (up to 30% of your time).

ASML produces high tech and high value products to semiconductor manufacturers. Downtime of these tools is very expensive for our customers. To minimize those costs ASML Customer Support organization is responsible to repair the systems as soon as possible. For this reason ASML ensures 24/7 support by covering 3x8 hours in 3 different continents with offices in the Netherlands, USA and Taiwan.

Each of the incidents seen at customer site are analyzed and documented to prevent similar incidents in future.

Role and responsibilities
A role as Global Support Center (GSC) Engineer in the ASML Customer Support department consists of a diversity of tasks and responsibilities. These tasks and responsibilities are varying with the phase of system maturity which makes the job challenging:

1.Solving complex technical problems by remote analyzing data and creating deterministic forward looking action plans is key for a GSC Engineer. It is important to have good alignment on expectations with the local team and your other GSC colleagues worldwide within this problem solving process. Involving additional help from development engineers helps to drive fast incident resolution. On-site support is often required to solve the problem at the customer.

2.Next to solving a technical problem a GSC engineer is responsible to start the process to prevent the issue of happening again in future. Collaboration with the departments Industrial Engineering and Development is necessary to establish that goal.

3.The diversity of problems in a fast evolving company requires a continuous drive to stay updated and informed on new technologies, functionalities and products. Being eager to learn and absorb this knowledge are very valuable within GSC.

4.Sharing knowledge and expertise amongst colleagues within the GSC and with local engineers increases the efficiency of our customer service. Travelling on-site when new system types are introduced to customers is an example of this aspect.

Education and experience
Master degree in technical science (Physics, Mechatronics, Electronics, Mechanical Engineering, etc.) or equivalent experience is desired

Preferably 2 or more years of experience as a Customer Support Engineer in a technical environment, as well as proven troubleshooting skills
Knowledge of ASML equipment on a specialized technical level is a pre

Skills
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

“Get things done” mentality
Pro-active attitude
Strong analytical skills
Interpersonal abilities (Can relate well to others, both colleagues and customers)
Effective communicator in English (both oral and written)
Customer-oriented
Flexible in working hours, travel and work environments
Team player
Stress resistant

Other information
Illumination, Dose Control & Projection (ILP)

The general purpose of the ILP group is to ensure that our systems can provide uniform light and quality images to ensure good wafer exposure during production.
As a GSC ILP engineer you will be responsible to troubleshoot & resolve issues related to equipment problems in the sub-competences; Illumination (Systems complete optical light path), Dose control (Deep UV light source and control of its energy and intensity) and the projection lens. This requires a strong analytical skill-set combined with clear and understandable communication. Next to that it is required to have affinity with hands-on skills.

job_name: CS - Field Application Engineer - Linkou - J-00265917-313
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
An application engineer plays an unique role as technology enabler to support our customer continuously development in lithography of semiconductor industry

Role and responsibilities
Application engineer supports ASML product in 3 phases:
- Business development: translate customer requirement into potential business development
- New product introduction: new platform insertion in customer R&D / Pilot Fab
- High volume manufacturing: sustain installed base machines for on product performance issues
• Help new product business development include bridging D&E idea and customer requirement/demand.
• Familiar with semiconductor litho-process, optical & metrology mechanism, able to do on product troubleshooting under time pressure
• Able to understand customer’s needs and clearly describe the issues that customer is facing to internal stakeholders
• Act as the owner of customer requests and follow through. (customer interfacing, data collection, 1st hand analysis, etc)
• Escalate/Communicate the issues to ASML experts in headquarter when needed without losing the ownership. Drive for progress and containment/solution
• Able work and coordinate across departments to ensure smooth troubleshooting process
• Able to present and report clearly during internal and external meetings.

Education and experience
Master of Optical/Physical engineering, Material/Chemical science, Mechanical engineering
3 - 5 years in semiconductor industry, optical engineering

Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

•Excellent English presentation and communication skills to interface internal (business development managers, project leaders, management) and external customers (mainly execution and mid to high management level).
•Troubleshooting skill, basic project management
•Basic programming skill (Matlab/Python) will be plus

Diversity & Inclusion
ASML is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

Other information
This position is based in Linkou, working together with leading edge semiconductor customers. To fulfill customer’s needs, Application engineer always looking for potential improvement beyond current machine spec with supporting from different department (D&E/marketing/equipment engineering). Application engineer is creating value by integration of multiple professional area.
High quality people are a key asset to our company. To recognize that, we offer highly competitive compensation and benefits packages to attract and retain the very best people and let them share in the success that they build. Our rewards philosophy is to attract and retain specific professional knowledge and competencies within the company by offering a competitive package in local markets where ASML is active.

job_name: D&E - Distributed Computing Infrastructure Architect - Linkou - J-00261300-121
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
You will be working in the virtual compute platform (VCP). This platform is developed inside ASML to host compute and analytics applications that aim to improve the yield in the semiconductor factories of our customers.

These applications take data from ASML equipment. They combine this data to real time production corrections. The corrections are sent back to the ASML production equipment. Failure of the platform has high impact. It would mean failure of the customers (tsmc, Samsung, Intel etc.) production facility.

The on-premise platform is currently developed based on DC/OS. We are in the process of migrating to Kubernetes. We develop the platform aspects in our team. Scheduling of resources, containerization, fail-over and data collection from scanner and measurement devices inside the fab. We have an up time expectation of 4 nine’s.

Installations and upgrades are automated with Ansible. Other technologies you may encounter are Spark for data processing, Kafka for notifications and high volume data ingestion. Hadoop and HBASE are used for data storage. Hyper converged CEPH storage is one of the candidates to replace the HDP stack.

Role and responsibilities
Align technical direction with other architects in all levels in VCP product roadmap, product design and development
Enable the team to control quality of solution and deliverable while leading the team in developing VCP product features
As competency leader to identify competence gap and lead the team to plan and complete competence development
Lead and manage architectural activities or technical improvement for the own team
Lead own team to support troubleshooting for in-house and field issues in Asia

Education and experience
A relevant BSc or MSc in the area of software engineering, computer science, information systems, IT or MIS

knowledge of distributed computing systems, on-premise infrastructure development and integration of open source and commercial solutions. 
resource management of DC/OS and Kubernetes. 
guide the troubleshooting actions for complex issues on system performance. 
Profound understanding of complexity in failover, replication, driving for 99.99% uptime. 
Linux expertise, Java, Networking, multi-threading and OS level scheduling. 
Hardware affinity; understand how server design contributes to resource usage. 
Proven experience in product development and software execution architecture. 

Skills
Working at the cutting edge of tech, you’ll always have new challenges and new problems to solve – and working together is the only way to do that. You won’t work in a silo. Instead, you’ll be part of a creative, dynamic work environment where you’ll collaborate with supportive colleagues. There is always space for creative and unique points of view. You’ll have the flexibility and trust to choose how best to tackle tasks and solve problems.
To thrive in this job, you’ll need the following skills:

Containerization, Kubernetes, Ansible, Docker, Spark, Python, Kafka,
Hadoop and HBASE, CEPH, MongoDb, Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP)
Networking, understand TCP/IP protocol, troubleshoot firewall config issues etc.
Linux, OS Hardening, Containerization, Azure DevOps, RHEV, RHEL

You take ownership and you support your team, you are the backbone of your group.
You are client and quality oriented – you do not settle for second best solutions, but you strive to find the best ways to acquire top results.
You like to solve problems (permanently)
You are open to Challenges
You think outside the box
You can look through the customer eyes, what worked before may need to change for a customer X
You automate
You have a positive attitude and are not stuck in dogmas, you combine a fresh view and apply experience equally


Other information
Keywords: Kubernetes, DCOS, Ansible, MongoDB, Spark, Kafka, Docker, Linux, Bamboo, Azure DevOps, Artifactory, RHEV, RHEL, life-cycle management

job_name: CSCM - Global Operations Center Planner (Spotfire Specialist) - Linkou/ Taichung (12-hr day/night shift)
cust_name: (ASML)台灣艾司摩爾科技股份有限公司
job_detail:
Introduction to the job
Do you like challenges and do you want to work in a fast pacing supply chain environment to support some of the biggest semiconductor companies worldwide? Are you familiar with Logistics Operations and like to managing urgent demands on a daily basis? 
If this sounds like you and if you have a strong customer oriented mindset, here is your mission.


Role and responsibilities
For our Global Operations Center in Taichung in Taiwan we are searching for Supply Chain Professionals. You fulfill the demand of our customers for spare parts and tools for their maintenance activities on some of the most complex machines in the right quantity and at the right time & cost.
Time is of the essence to ensure a seamless production of our customers without interruptions on our machines.

- Handling of material requests from worldwide customers in a rolling 24/7 shift system while meeting all milestones related to communication and execution
- Monitoring of worldwide shipments
- Develop, implement, and maintain state-of-the art GOC reports and dashboards for the stakeholders
- Define the methodology for creating visibility in GOC with new reporting perspective
- Translate/refine requirements and visualize data into information that can be used to take appropriate action
- Continuously improve information services in line with stakeholder needs, attunement of implementation planning, hands-on assistance, problem solving
- Be the Subject Matter Expert and the Key User of the reporting tools within GOC

Experience
- Proficient knowledge in multiple reporting tools such as Spotfire, SAP or Macro.
- Experience in Agile way of working is an advantage.
- Analytical and able to organize and prioritize own workload Personal skills
- Commitment to excellence, drive for quality results, act under high pressure
- Advance stakeholder management, team player, pro-active, result oriented, convincing and “can do” mentality, flexible and adaptive to change
- Excellent professional communication in English
- Highly analytical and able to organize and prioritize workload.
- 2 years relevant experience in multinational companies, ideally with Supply Chain, Sales Operations, Procurement, PM or Engineering background.
- Affinity with ERP; SAP, Python, Tabulate, and Macro experience is preferred Context of the position
- Relevant bachelor degree or above (Information Technology, Industrial Engineering & Management Science, Business Administration, Statistics, Computer Science, Supply Chain or Engineering)

Diversity & Inclusion

Other information
